title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: The valley of Hexham, including South Tyne up to Halt-whistle, and North Tyne to Bellingham, isa fine sharp loam ; and in this valley theharvests are the earliest, the trees have therichest foliage, and the landscape is themost diversified and interesting of any inNorthumberland.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: It consists of two branches,the North and South Tyne, which descending from the north and south-west, uniteat Hexham, the former rising behind CrossFell, in the south-western boundary of thecounty, and the latter in the hills to thesouth of the Carter Fell, receiving at Bellingham a considerable stream from theCarter, termed the Reed.

title: Hill-side and border sketches:
author: Maxwell, W. H.
snippet: He was born at Bellingham in 1704, and was first married to a girl of gipsy stamp, and after her death to the daughter of a clergyman who resided on the borders  of Scotland.
